required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise With Music for ICU Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Exercise With Music Program for ICU Survivors

brief_summary.textblock: This project will test whether the individualized music-enhanced exercise playlist (Exercise with Music intervention) can prevent further physical and psychological deterioration and motivate ICU survivors to more actively participate in their rehabilitation.

primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects enrolled into the study divided by number of subjects approached X 100%

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of intervention as measured by a questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: A self-designed 8-item questionnaire is administered to assess subjects' feedback regarding the intervention. Five questions are likert-scale questions (strongly disagree, disagree, undecided, agree, strongly agree); three questions are yes or no questions. If the results of the questionnaire show that majority of patients answer "agree or strongly agree" and "yes", this would indicate that the intervention is acceptable. If the results of the questionnaire show that majority of the patients answer "strongly disagree or disagree" and "no", this would indicate that the intervention is not acceptable.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants that complete the intervention as prescribed
primary_outcome.description: Count of participants who exercise twice daily for five days (upper and lower extremity exercise). Each session includes five movements. The number of movements and sessions of the intervention delivered within and beyond the 5-day mandatory regimen will be documented.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants that complete the intervention beyond the 5-day mandatory sessions
primary_outcome.description: Count of participants who complete additional exercise sessions beyond the prescribed exercise regimen (twice daily for five days). Each session includes five movements.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrence in a participant, which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the trial intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect size of the Exercise with Music intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Estimated effect size of the intervention on outcome measures to calculate sample size for a larger future study.

Activity will be monitored using an Actiwatch (Philips Respironics) placed on subjects' wrists at enrollment. The Actiwatch is a small, lightweight, limb-worn activity monitoring device. It contains an accelerometer that is capable of sensing any motion with minimal acceleration of 0.01g to measure long-term gross motor activity and intensity of motion.
Grip strength will be assessed using handgrip dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes grip strength at hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Grip strength will be assessed using handgrip dynamometer.
Foot strength will be assessed objectively using hand-held dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Foot Strength at hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Foot strength will be assessed objectively using hand-held dynamometer.
Motivation will be measured by the visual analog scale (VAS) with scores from 0 to 100. "0" indicates "not motivated to do exercise at all"; "100" indicates "extremely motivated to do exercise".

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Motivation (Visual Analog Scale) at hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Motivation will be measured by the visual analog scale (VAS) with scores from 0 to 100. "0" indicates "not motivated to do exercise at all"; "100" indicates "extremely motivated to do exercise".
Anxiety will be measured by the visual analog scale (VAS) with scores from 0 to 100. "0" indicates "no anxiety"; "100" indicates "extremely anxious".

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Anxiety (Visual Analog Scale) at hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety will be measured by the visual analog scale (VAS) with scores from 0 to 100. "0" indicates "no anxiety"; "100" indicates "extremely anxious".

Anxiety will also be assessed using the NIH Toolbox Emotion Battery (fear-affect survey), CAT format. Each item administered has a 5-point scale with options ranging from "never" to "always." The survey is scored using IRT methods. Higher scores are indicative of more feelings of anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Anxiety (NIH Toolbox) at hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety will also be assessed using the NIH Toolbox Emotion Battery (fear-affect survey), CAT format. Each item administered has a 5-point scale with options ranging from "never" to "always." The survey is scored using IRT methods. Higher scores are indicative of more feelings of anxiety.

Depression will be assessed using the NIH Toolbox Emotion Battery (sadness survey), CAT format. Each item administered has a 5-point scale with options ranging from "never" to "always" (adults) or "almost always". higher scores are indicative of more depressive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Depression (NIH Toolbox) at hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Depression will be assessed using the NIH Toolbox Emotion Battery (sadness survey), CAT format. Each item administered has a 5-point scale with options ranging from "never" to "always" (adults) or "almost always". higher scores are indicative of more depressive.

arm_group.description: The Exercise with Music intervention is a recorded exercise playlist, which is tailored to a patient's individual physical abilities and music choices.
The active control group will receive exercise brochure and will be advised to exercise at least twice daily.

intervention.description: The Exercise with Music intervention is recorded exercise playlist, which provide exercise instructions tailored to patients' musical choices and exercise capacity.
The exercise group will receive exercise brochure and will be advised to exercise at least twice daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age ≥ 18 years old
- length of ICU stay >5 days (excludes patients with less comorbidity)
- within 72 hours of ICU discharge (standardizes time to begin intervention)
- ability to independently move upper and lower extremities (required to participate in intervention)
- ability to speak English or Spanish
Exclusion Criteria:
- documented mental incompetence
- dependent status pre-ICU admission (KATZ, activity daily living scale)
- evidence of delirium using the Confusion Assessment Method (CAM)
- hearing impairment
- documented "comfort measures only" in the electronic medical record
- prior residence in a long-term care facility
- unstable hemodynamics
